knimeNode.name: Scripting
knimeNode.shortDescription: Executes a user-defined Scijava Command script row-wise.

fullDescription.intro: Scijava Commands are a flexible interface for processing code. They are implemented in ImageJ plugins and can be executed and coded directly in KNIME using this Node.

tab.name: Script Editor
tab.option:
A built-in script editor in which the script for this node is directly editable.
Limitations:
The Script is executed once per row, you won't be able to keep any state between rows or perform table wide calculations.
You may not modify the input parameters as this will lead to undefined behavior.
Supported Input Types:
Double
Integer
Boolean
String
KNIP Image
KNIP Labeling
Supported Output Types:
Double / double
Integer / int
Boolean / boolean
String / Char
Img / ImgPlus / RandomAccesibleInterval
ImgPlusLabeling
Available Libraries
ImageJ Ops
ImgLib2 and all sub libraries

Below the main editor you find the column input mapping table. This is where you can assign columns of the input table to inputs of your Scijava Command script. Add a mapping with the big "+" button and then change its column by clicking on the column name in the newly created row.
To remove a mapping use the "-" button. In case you do not want to remove the mapping, you can deactivate it by disabling the check box in the "Active" column. Deactivated mappings will not be used and can easily be reactivated later, if needed again.

The input column list shows the currently available columns in the table assigned to the ScriptingNode input port. You can easily add column to input mappings from here by double clicking on the column.

tab.name: Script Dialog Tab
tab.option:
This tab contains ways to set those of your scripts inputs which have not been resolved by a column to input mapping yet.
As soon as you add a column input mapping for a certain input, the user interface to set its value will disappear and only reappear once the corresponding mapping has been removed or deactivated.

tab.name: Output Table
tab.option:
Settings for the creation of the output columns.
"New Table" - Puts the output columns into a new table.
"Append Columns" - Appends the output columns onto the input table.
Suffix to append at the end of column names when "Append Columns" creation mode is selected. This is mainly to avoid creating columns with names equal to names of input columns.

ports.inPort: Data table to input to the script.
ports.outPort: Output of the script as a table.
